Mother and Father divorced. Father has primary decision making custodial control at present. The initial dx made two
weeks ago. RX with Metadate CD 10 mg and Lexapro 5 mg started.
Mother was invited to first evaluation. She arrived at the office more than 30 minutes into the appointment.
Mother was invited to today's appt as well. Father and daughter were in room without mother for first ten minutes of
the interview. During this time, the PATIENT stated that the current combination was very beneficial to her. Focus had
improved, retention improved, and she has become much more efficient. She feels the 10 mg dose covers wellfor
most of the day but wanes by last period of the day. Anxiety and panic attacks are significantly improved with the
exception of, "When I have to go see the counsellor with my Mother. That makes me have a panic attack because
she lies." The she refers to Mother. We discussed taking lnderal priorto counselling session as that might make them
more meaningful to the patient. Mother was not there during that part of the discussion.
Mother came to the room. The question of current status was posed. A plea was made to keep this conversation all
about helping the child and not about the conflict they have in their life.
The usage of an extensive history and scales as listed above were used to make the diagnosis. Meds were tried in
accordance with current guidelines. Patient claimed success on all fronts.
At this point, Mother requested that the child be excused from the room.
Mother stated that she did not understand why the child was being treated with medication.
The discussion was reiterated that standardized testing was used to justify medical diagnosis. lntervention was based
on that. Mom tried to state that the sx all began when Father assumed full custody.
When Mom was redirected that the ADHD sx and Anxiety sx began in grade three. Mom then acknowledged that this
was likely.
She then stated that the child was much worse since starting the medications.
That was not the feelings of the patient. She feels that the meds have been very beneficial.
Father's observations confirm that as well. Teachers affirm the progress.
Mom claimed that those were not her observations. Father questioned when Mom had been around the child to make
any observations. Mom stated that the child should be under the care of a psychiatrist.
Especially since she was on high doses of heavy medications.
The conversation then turned back to why she was on meds for the third time.
"Everybody sees she is much worse on these medications."
When attempting to answer the questions for the third time, The mother made the allegation that Father was seeking
meds like this so that he could sell those medications. lt was apparent that the Mother had a focus on something
other than the medical conditions of the child as she was escalating the conversation to direct conflict. I terminated
the conversation at this point and instructed the Mother to leave or she would be escorted out by law enforcement.
Mother had her cellphone out during the interview. lf she recorded or videoed this conversation this was not disclosed
Permission was not granted by either father or me.

Patient Instructions
VIRAL SYNDROME
You were seen today for a viral illness. Many illnesses in children are caused by a variety of viruses. Some of these
viruses we have names for and can identify, many we cannot. Most viral illnesses in children resolve on their own
without any specific therapy, although it may takeT-10 days for all symptoms to resolve. During the period of illness it
is important that children have adequate resVsleep, adequate fluid intake and that they remain home from school/day
care until they are fever-free x 24 hours and feeling improved. Please call our office if your child is acting very ill,
lethargic or excessively irritable, having trouble breathing, appearing dehydrated or if you have other concerns. For
more information on infections in children visit:
http://www. healthychildren. org/English/health-issues/conditions/infections/Pages/Overview-of-lnfectious-
Diseases.aspx
PHARYNGITIS -RS
You were seen in our office today for a sore throat (pharyngitis) that was felt to be due to a vlrus. Most sore throats in
children are not caused by strep. lf we performed a throat culture in our office, please follow up as directed. lf we did
not perform a throat culture, it was because your symptoms and exam were typical of a viral sore throat which needs
no specific treatment. You should make your child comfortable, encourage fluids (non-acidic) and allow them to rest.
Acetaminophen or ibuprofen may be administered if needed for fever or sore throat pain. Call our office if your child is
not improving in 3-4 days, has trouble swallowing, appears dehydrated or you have concerns. Additlonal information
may be available at:
